label: 足利義満
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Ashikaga Yoshimitsu (足利義満), and sometimes called Kitayamadono (北山殿). This 3rd shōgun of the Ashikaga bakufu was the son of Yoshiakira, and became shōgun the year after the death of his father in 1368, when still only 10. In 1392, he accomplished the reunification of the northern and southern dynasties, and two years later, made his son Yoshimochi shōgun and was named prime minister (太政大臣 daijō daijin) of the imperial government in 1392, though he quit to become a monk the next year, and spent the rest of his days actively supporting the construction of stūpas and temples.  He died in 1408.
